page.title: 01CHICHESTER-NORTH.
page.content: The city of {Chichester,}the county town of {West Sussex, }has grown up amid the fertile coastal plain between the chalk{ South Downs}and the{Channel {coast. Chichester North}comprises the northern part of the walled city from a line running West to East through Crane Street and the present northern limits of the city near{ Lavant }and Raughmere House. In the East it is bordered by the Goodwood Estate & to the West by Fishbourne & open country. Beyond the city walls is predominantly a residential area with some public services for the county. Woodland and farmland have been lost, but beyond the housing these still remain. The farming is mostly arable, cropping cereals. Gravel is still worked here from the coastal plain deposits. The River Lavant flows through the area to the sea, but it is now more a stream.
